title: Calories in Chicken Roast
meta_description: Discover calories in chicken roast per 100 g, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Skinless, roasted whole chicken (mixed white and dark meat), no added oils, salts, or seasonings; average values from USDA data.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by chicken size, cut, cooking method, added ingredients, and brand; always check labels or use a food scale for precision.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of roasted chicken provides about 190 kcal and 25 g of protein.

label_note: Values align with Nutrition Facts labels for straightforward comparison and meal planning.

tweaks.label: With skin on (adds fat per 100 g)
Add 1 tsp olive oil for roasting per 100 g
Breast meat only (leaner, skinless per 100 g)

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g chicken roast?
faqs.a: Approximately 190 kcal for skinless roasted chicken.

faqs.q: What's the protein in chicken roast?
faqs.a: About 25 g protein per 100 g, making it a high-protein option.
Roasting without added fat keeps calories low; oils or skin increase them.

faqs.q: Calories in a whole roasted chicken?
faqs.a: A 1.5 kg whole chicken yields ~800-1000 kcal total, depending on size and prep.
Yes, 0 g carbs per 100 g, ideal for low-carb or keto diets.
